metadata.abstractText: Use of lithium-sulfur battery (LSB) is an attractive approach to achieve cost-effective and high energy density batteries. However, the insulating nature of active materials, shuttle effect, and slow redox kinetics lead to severe capacity decay and low rate capabilities. Numerous multi-modal approaches have been attempted to tackle these issues and have pushed the cycle stability and energy density to the higher level. Recently, accelerating the redox kinetics using catalytic materials has been considered to realize high performance LSB. In this Minireview, an insightful overview of the advances in LSB catalytic material design and mechanistic descriptions of their catalytic activities are comprehensively provided.
